title: RustDoc panics at 'no entry found for key' when documenting code that implements the `acpi::AcpiHandler` trait

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
When documenting code that depends on the [`acpi` crate](https://docs.rs/acpi/latest/acpi/) and contains a type which implements the [`AcpiHandler` trait](https://docs.rs/acpi/latest/acpi/) from `acpi`, RustDoc panics with the message 'no entry found for key'. This panic appears to be quite similar to the one described in issue #103463. However, the commit fixing that issue was merged in #103649 (12 days ago), and this panic is still reproducible on the latest nightly (e631891f7 2022-11-13), while the panic with the `luminance` crate described by #103463 is not reproducible on the latest nightly. Additionally, unlike #103463, simply `use`ing `acpi::AcpiHandler` is not sufficient to cause the panic; the crate that depends on `acpi` must actually implement the trait in order to cause RustDoc to panic. Therefore, I thought this seemed like it deserved a separate issue from #103463. ### Code `Cargo.toml`: ```toml [package] name = "rustdoc-panic-repro" version = "0.1.0" edition = "2021" [dependencies] acpi = "4" ``` `lib.rs` ```Rust #[derive(Clone)] struct MyAcpiHandler; impl acpi::AcpiHandler for MyAcpiHandler { unsafe fn map_physical_region(&self, _: usize, _: usize) -> acpi::PhysicalMapping { unimplemented!() } fn unmap_physical_region(_: &acpi::PhysicalMapping) { unimplemented!() } } ``` A Git repository containing the reproduction is also available here: https://github.com/hawkw/rustdoc-panic-repro ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.67.0-nightly (e631891f7 2022-11-13) binary: rustc commit-hash: e631891f7ad40eac3ef58ec3c2b57ecd81e40615 commit-date: 2022-11-13 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.67.0-nightly LLVM version: 15.0.4 ``` ### Error output ```console $ cargo doc Documenting rustdoc-panic-repro v0.1.0 (/home/eliza/Code/rustdoc-panic-repro) thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no entry found for key', src/librustdoc/passes/collect_intra_doc_links.rs:782:16 stack backtrace: ```
Backtrace

``` thread 'rustc' panicked at 'no entry found for key', src/librustdoc/passes/collect_intra_doc_links.rs:782:16 stack backtrace: 0: 0x7fb307758e40 - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::libunwind::trace::he4d5f2c13fd7ea58 at /rustc/e631891f7ad40eac3ef58ec3c2b57ecd81e40615/library/std/src/../../backtrace/src/backtrace/libunwind.rs:93:5 1: 0x7fb307758e40 -
